messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:2291 PS scare tactics
messages.msgSnippet: On Tue, 27 Aug 2002 17:13:19 -0400 Luz Shosie and Ned Vare ... Well, it s nothing to worry about *here*, anyway. It s the same thing they ve been saying for
messages.messageBody:
On Tue, 27 Aug 2002 17:13:19 -0400 Luz Shosie and Ned Vare
<nedvare@...> writes:
> Are you
> trying to tell this list that even though counties in CA are using
> scare
> tactics against homeschoolers, that it's nothing to worry about
> anywhere and
> the unschool list should not discuss it?
>
> And, in all respect, what do you mean by "nothing more than" scare
> tactics?

Well, it's nothing to worry about *here*, anyway. It's the same thing
they've been saying for years, and yet I'm not aware of a single county
that's ever won.

Dar

messages.subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:2291 PS scare tactics
messages.msgSnippet: ... There seems to be a strange glitch in the system somewhere, and posts which were obviously sent hours ago - like this one of Ned s - are just showing up on
messages.messageBody:
At 5:13 PM -0400 8/27/02, Luz Shosie and Ned Vare wrote:
>on 8/26/02 7:33 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
>Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:
>Helen Hegener wrote
>> letter from HSC's legal
>>> counsel, Linda
>>> Conrad-Jansen: "...the letters received from
>>> counties in the last
>>> month regarding the new procedures are nothing more
>>> than scare
>>> tactics designed to get more homeschoolers into the
>>> public school
>>> homeschooling programs."
>
>Thanks Helen for your comments about my post and for posting this. Are you
>trying to tell this list that even though counties in CA are using scare
>tactics against homeschoolers, that it's nothing to worry about anywhere and
>the unschool list should not discuss it?
>
>And, in all respect, what do you mean by "nothing more than" scare tactics?
>
>Ned Vare

There seems to be a strange glitch in the system somewhere, and posts
which were obviously sent hours ago - like this one of Ned's - are
just showing up on my computer now.

If you read carefully you'll see that I didn't make the statement
about "nothing more than" scare tactics - HSC legal advisor Linda
Conrad-Jansen did. What I was saying was that this has happened
before and homeschool leaders in California are dealing with it quite
capably. For more information please visit the web site for the
Homeschool Association of California: http://www.hsc.org

For the record: I don't have any objections to a discussion of the
situation on this list.

Helen

messages.subject: Re:2291 PS scare tactics
messages.msgSnippet: on 8/26/02 7:33 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote: Helen Hegener wrote ... Thanks Helen for your comments
messages.messageBody:
on 8/26/02 7:33 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:
Helen Hegener wrote
> letter from HSC's legal
>> counsel, Linda
>> Conrad-Jansen: "...the letters received from
>> counties in the last
>> month regarding the new procedures are nothing more
>> than scare
>> tactics designed to get more homeschoolers into the
>> public school
>> homeschooling programs."

Thanks Helen for your comments about my post and for posting this. Are you
trying to tell this list that even though counties in CA are using scare
tactics against homeschoolers, that it's nothing to worry about anywhere and
the unschool list should not discuss it?

And, in all respect, what do you mean by "nothing more than" scare tactics?

Ned Vare
